metadata.name: The Infinite Loop
metadata.description:
This work of art depicts the complexity of our cosmos: how each galaxy is a microcosm of another galaxy. The radius of the observable universe is estimated to be 45.6 billion light-years.

 The unobservable Universe, on the other hand, is estimated to be at least about 23 trillion light years in diameter, containing a volume of space that's over 15 million times as large as the volume we can observe.

Yet, the universe continues to expand making our universe an infinite/endless loop.
